CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 4, 1952, pg. 1, reads: "Where Segregation Exists - Poor equipment and rundown fire houses, the usual pattern of segregation wherever you find it, exists in these two fire houses. ...and the one on the right is Fire Station 26 at the corner of Wandless Street and Webster Avenue. - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Pittsburgh Fire Department Engine House 26, with man seated next to doorway, 2854 Webster Avenue at Wandless Street, Hill District
